intro: Hypochaeris robertia, commonly known as the common sowthistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Hypochaeris robertia is an annual or biennial plant with a cosmopolitan distribution.
